instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dropping voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board had very small liquid damage around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is dropping to around 5V then spike to 8V-11V and drop within a few seconds to 5V and spike again.
Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> just in case but still same results.
Tested with a few DC boards.

Same voltage results on fuse on DC board.
When DC board is not connected to the main logic board voltage is correct and stable.

Any ideas guys?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dropping voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dropping voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dropping voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dropping voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
What? How is a dead <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (NOT <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) causing the pin 27/28 wrong reading?????

This is just a corroded resistor <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 or the traces between them and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>/<RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dropping voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
It was corroded <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>.
Problem solved - many thanks for help.
